page.title: 07CHURCHES IN ALL STRETTON
page.content: St Michael and All Angels church was built of stone in{1902.}The stone came from Batch valley quarry. At the bottom of the path leading up to the church there is a wooden{lych gate.} One of the most beautiful things in the church is{the kneelers.}These were made by the ladies of the church. They all have different pictures of nature embroidered on them. There are some{unusual windows}in memory of a local doctor. They were engraved by John Hutton who also did the windows in Coventry Cathedral. Recently the United Reformed Church was sold and converted into a house. The vestry in St Michael's church has been made into a small chapel for the URC to use instead. This arrangement seems to work very well and sometimes they have{combined services. }
